candidates.title: Upgrade to ash 0.34 with ash-window 0.8
candidates.body: This ash release switches over to a dynamically linked scheme where Vulkan is linked directly instead of through libloading by default.  As the main library crate doesn't need to load an entrypoint such linking is not desired at all and is disabled by default (as is runtime linking, effectively no entrypoints can be loaded): it must be re-enabled by hand when building the examples.

candidates.title: 🤷 cargo: Remove unused widestring and hassle-rs dependency
candidates.body: Didn't get to reviewing #79 midnight, and it got 🥷-merged in the morning 😬

candidates.title: cargo: Include license files in crate
candidates.body:
When explicitly specifying what files to include, cargo does not include license files [1] unless it was a custom license specified with `license-file`.

Fixes: 1c7a78f ("Add MIT and Apache 2.0 license texts (#76)")

[1]: https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-exclude-and-include-fields

candidates.title: Update description now that we support Dx12
Update imgui to 0.8 and winit to 0.25
candidates.body: Same as #65 but with dependent PRs #28 and #29 merged in first, separately, for better bisectionability may something break along the way - and for easier patch-notes generation.

candidates.title: Update imgui to 0.8 and winit to 0.25
candidates.body:
Depends on #28 and #29

#29 went down on winit version to accomodate `imgui-winit-support 0.7`'s usage of `winit 0.24`.

This also omits some id (label with `##`) assignments which are unnecessary when the item resides inside a stack with a unique item: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md#q-how-can-i-have-multiple-widgets-with-the-same-label
These labels should only be used when:
- The label changes based on some dynamic variable like a counter while
  still representing the same object;
- Duplicate labels inside the same stack-item.

candidates.title: Change winapi dependency from git to the latest released version
candidates.body: Winapi was set to a custom branch that adds some `d3d12` bindings for ray tracing. The `d3d12` version of `gpu-allocator` does not use any of those features, so we can simply use the latest version published on crates.io.

candidates.title: Remove winapi from public interface.
candidates.body:
In our own projects we are running on a different branch of winapi. This causes all types to be incompatible. Additionally, it would be nice to have the option to use `windows-rs`.
In order to achieve these goals we want to remove `winapi` from the public facing API. Luckily this comes down to having two abstract pointer types around and a helper that is now behind a feature flag.

candidates.title: visualization: Replace custom event conversion with imgui-winit-support
